contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement <!-- See Template:Infobox settlement for additional fields and descriptions --> | name = Rapla County | settlement_type = [[Counties of Estonia|County of Estonia]] | image_flag = Raplamaa_lipp.svg | flag_size = 125px | image_shield = Raplamaa_vapp.svg | shield_size = 75px | image_map = Rapla in Estonia.svg | subdivision_type = [[List of sovereign states|Country]] | subdivision_name = [[Estonia]] | seat_type = Capital | seat = [[Rapla]] | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = Tõnis Blank | area_total_km2 = 2980 | population_total = 36678 | population_as_of = Jan 2009<ref name="County_population" /> | population_density_km2 = auto | iso_code = EE-70 | website = | footnotes = }} '''Rapla County''' ({{lang-et|Rapla maakond}}), or '''''Raplamaa''''', is one of 15 [[Counties of Estonia|counties]] of [[Estonia]]. It is situated in western part of the country and borders [[Järva County]] to the east, [[Pärnu County]] to the south, [[Lääne County]] to the west, and [[Harju County]] to the north. 36,678 people live in Rapla County – constituting 2.7% of the total population in Estonia (as of January 2009).<ref name="County_population">{{cite web|url=http://pub.stat.ee/px-web.2001/Dialog/varval.asp?ma=PO0222&path=../I_Databas/Population/01Population_indicators_and_composition/04Population_figure_and_composition/&lang=1|title=Population by sex, ethnic nationality and County, 1 January|date=1 January 2009|work=stat.ee|publisher=[[Statistics Estonia]]|accessdate=2009-10-18}}</ref> == History == The first written records of Rapla date back to the 1241 Danish census (''Liber Census Daniae''). == County government == The [[County Governments of Estonia|County Government]] (Estonian: ''Maavalitsus'') is led by a [[County Governors of Estonia|Governor]] (Estonian: ''maavanem''), who is appointed by the [[Government of Estonia]] for a term of five years. Since 9 August 2004, the Governor position is held by [[Tiit Leier]]. == Municipalities == [[Image:Rapla municipalities.png|thumb|left|300px|Municipalities of Rapla County]] The county is subdivided into [[Municipalities of Estonia|municipalities]]. There are 10 rural municipalities (Estonian: ''vallad'' – parishes) in Rapla County: *[[Juuru Parish]] *[[Järvakandi]] (''borough'') *[[Kaiu Parish]] *[[Kehtna Parish]] *[[Kohila Parish]] (''includes the borough of [[Kohila]]'') *[[Käru Parish]] *[[Märjamaa Parish]] (''includes the borough of [[Märjamaa]]'') *[[Raikküla Parish]] *[[Rapla Parish]] (''includes the town of [[Rapla]]'') *[[Vigala Parish]] {{clear}} == Geography == Natural resources found in Rapla county include [[limestone]], [[dolomite]], [[peat]], and [[clay]]. == Miscellaneous topics == The church of Rapla was built in 1901. However, much of the interior dates back to several hundred years earlier and is of high virtu and historical value. In the church yard there are several crosses remaining from the 17th century. == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.raplamv.ee/kl/ County Government] Official website {{Navboxes |title = <!-- [[Image:Nuvola filesystems www.png|23px]] --> Geographic locale |list = {{Raplamaa}} {{Counties of Estonia}} {{Cities_of_Estonia}} }} {{coord|58|55|N|24|45|E|type:adm1st_region:EE|display=title}} <!--Categories--> [[Category:Rapla County| ]] [[Category:Counties of Estonia]]
